page.title: 12MEIR AERODROME (CLOSED 1972)
page.content: This civil airfield housed No.28 Flying Training School which was operated by Reid & Sigrist using Hind,Hart & Magister trainers.The school closed in 1939.Off Grindley Lane were "flight sheds" where planes were assembled.In June 1940 No.5 Flying Training School arrived from Hanworth and remained until being disbanded in 1945.In addit- ion the airfield was connected to Rootes Securities at Blythe Bridge.Beau fighters and Blenheims were built and test-flown.Scheduled services were oper ated to Jersey by Jersey Airlines and to the Isle of Man by Dragon Airlines in the 1950s.B.E.A.experimented with a helicopter service but not start it. R.A.F.Cadets and North Staffs.Gliding Club used gliders.For business Keele St.Pottery(Staffordshire Potteries) op- erated a Gemini,then a Dragon Rapide and finally a Jetranger Helicopter.
